aboutOP:
// OnomatoPedal? //

OnomatoPedal(OP) is an audiovisual playground inspired by the Onomatopoetic words and the music effects pedals of the world famous EarthQuaker Devices. Each OP are crafted by artists, and users can play a set of sounds and animations with the keys on your computer keyboard or drumpad on your mobile devices.
It started as a fun project among friends, and becoming a experimental collaboration platform between musical artists and multimedia visual artists who create interactive animations.
Twenty-two OPs were released between 2020 to 2021 as version 1 OPs, inspired by Japanese onomatopoetic words. All samples and music from V1 are available under a Creative Commons Attribution-ShareAlike 4.0 International License, and they are downloadable from each OP page.
Version 2 OPs started to be released from Oct 2023, with wider variety of interactions in both music and visual. We hope you enjoy this new experience of music and art from your home or anywhere.
We are accepting submission from musicians and generative artists all over the world to be a part of our community. If you are experimental musician or generative geek and think your art fits in this project, please contact PatternBased with links to your work.

OnomatoPedal(OP) is an audiovisual playground inspired by the Onomatopoetic words and the music effects pedals of the world famous EarthQuaker Devices. howToPlay:
// How To Play //

On Desktop

You will be able to play a set of sounds and animations with the keys on your computer keyboard. Activated keys varies (in all alphabets and nunmber keys) for each OnomatoPedal(OP), and it is displayed on the screen. Some newer OPs also have 'stems' which is layers/channels of the background music that can be mute/unmute separately while playing.

On Mobile

Tap 'Play Mode' or 'Play' to enter Play Mode, the musical track will start and you will see drum pads. You can play drum pads along with the music track, or mute the music to just play the pads.
credits:
// Credit //

Onomatopedals

Music by Puffy Shapes, Low in the Sky, Gnosotros, Microstructures, Full Blown Kirk, Taka Tozawa, Billy Dixon, Corey Farrow, Patrick McNulty, Kevin Carr, Joe Golden, Corey Haren, Cory Juba, Jamie Stillman, Ben Vehorn, Michael Tolan, Krista Tortora, Josh Weatherspoon, Jack Randall, Brett Lashua, Ralph Carney, Karl Vorndran, Curt Brown, Jacob Trombetta, Jeff France, Joseph Minadeo, Delia Nakamura and Hainbach

Animation by oqlolpo, and Siori Kitajima

Recorded and produced in Tokyo, Kyoto, San Francisco, Los Angeles, Berlin, Akron, Morongo Valley, and Nagasaki

OnomatoPedal, The album is available at the PatternBased Bandcamp.

OnomatoPedal App

Created by PatternBased

Design and Code by Siori Kitajima
Fork this project on github

Music production/curation by Joseph Minadeo

Pedal circuits by Jamie Stillman

Pedal graphics by Matt Horak and Jamie Stillman

Japanese Onomatope description by An Illustrated Dictionary of Japanese Onomatopoetic Expressions by Taro Gomi, published by Kodansha Ltd,

Acknowledgement

Made with amazing tools including p5.js, Tone.js, Paper.js, Howler.js, VCV Rack, Bfxr, NI Polyplex, Ableton, OP-1, Arturia, Omnisphere, Output, Fractal Bits and TTSMP3

Thank you ♥ Julie Robbins, Jamie Stillman, Luke Zollinger, Geoff Crowe, Uri Garcia, Anna Blumenthal and everyone at EarthQuaker Devices, Shu Suetake, Takeshi Enjouji, Keita Tanaka and everyone at Yamaha Music Japan, Yugo Kitajima, Laura Apetroaei, Szigeti Lorand, Admiral Potato, Chiho Okada, Corabelle and Orlando.

modalMessage:
Play with the following 12 keys on your computer keyboard:
Z,X,C,V,A,S,D,F,Q,W,E,R
